channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A $6.2m banana, a crypto empire and Trump's potential conflicts
item.description: Trump's expanding business ventures have made it easier than ever for those hoping to influence US policy to steer money his way.

item.title: Dorothy's ruby slippers sell for $28m at auction
item.description: The shoes, worn by Judy Garland in the classic 1939 movie, went for $25m more than the auctioneer's estimate.

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO’s shooting opens a door for many to vent frustrations over insurance
Prithvi Shaw: The rise and fade of Indian cricket's wonder boy
item.description: It has been a steep fall for the 25-year-old batter, once hailed as Indian cricket's 'next big thing'.

item.title: Tyler Perry Studios president dies when plane he was piloting crashes
item.description: The plane crash happened in Homosassa, about 60 miles north of Tampa.

item.title: Assad flees Syria, war monitor says, as insurgents enter Damascus
item.description: Syrian insurgents reached Damascus as part of a rapidly moving offensive that saw them take over some of Syria's largest cities.

item.title: On secret military island, a mother strives to raise her children normally
item.description: Shanthi tried her best to create a sense of normality for her children on the secretive military island Diego Garcia

item.title: Photos: Notre Dame Cathedral reopens, with its first service since a devastating fire
item.description: The bells of Notre Dame Cathedral rang on Saturday evening in Paris for the first time since a fire heavily damaged the Paris landmark in 2019.

item.title: Ukrainians face another harsh winter as Russia attacks coal country
item.description: Many Ukrainians continue to leave their coal mining towns, with the front line of the war with Russia nearby.

item.title: FBI offers $50,000 reward for information about gunman who killed UnitedHealthcare’s CEO

item.description: Search widens for suspected gunman in killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO; How cork — the same material used to seal wine bottles — could save the planet.

item.title: South Korea's ex-defense minister detained over martial law declaration
item.description: The development came after South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol avoided an opposition-led bid to impeach him in parliament

item.title: How a uranium mine became a pawn in the row between Niger and France
item.description: France's nuclear giant has lost control of its uranium mining operations in the West African state.
